DarkHawk/Hydras/Perceptor:

Darkhawk Waitted impatient to set a blow, but h=
e didnt liked to interfere. Hydras had a rrived and watched it; he was amus=
ed to see what will happen next; Perceptor had a rrived too and remai  in s=
ilence 


From: Sandy 
Sent: Wednesday, February 17, 2010 10:07 PM
To: nbwr=
pg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortre


  
Tucson=
 nodds. And for the first time, even though he could not see from his eyes,=
 it appears that he looks Rodimus in the eyes, as Optimus would have done w=
ith Megatron many years ago. His expression stoic, as was Optimus Prime, an=
d then out of nowhere he gives his reply.

" It doesn't have to come to thi=
s, Rodimus, but you leave me with no choice. One shall rise, and one shall =
fall." 

His voice had always sounded like Optimus when he was his age. But=
 now, at this moment, it sounded more and more like the legendary Autobot l=
eader. Now something inside him was coming alive. A spirit that he had kept=
 deep down within him and now it was emerging. He did not cower in shock at=
 the thought of going toe to toe with Rodimus, although not thrilled with t=
he idea, as Optimus would have felt the same way, going against one of his =
own, but he knew it had to be done. Perhaps it was the first step in hopefu=
lly recovering his lost leader.

" It's clear to me that you have chosen th=
e same path Megatron chose years ago. A path that lead to his demise. So, i=
f this is the path you wish to take, then I fight you as an enemy."

His ey=
es do not narrow in rage, but take on a look of concentration. He'd need it=
 if he was going to go against Rodimus.

" I'm ready."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoo=
groups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> 
> >" Nothing com=
es easy, and I'm aware of that. I'm not here to take the easy way out. I sa=
id I'd do anything it took to restore my leader, and I am willing to stand =
by my pledge, no matter the cost to my own spark. So if it means comming da=
ngerously close to my own mortality, I accept the challenge. I am willing t=
o fight anyone who wishes to challenge me, and I pledge to fight in Warrior=
's honor." 
> >
> >He waits to find out who will take him up on his offer.
=
> 
> "Autobot" Scourge's dark tones move across the room as he watches Tusc=
on with narrow and dangerous optics, "You stand in the middle of Hydras' th=
rone, sneaking in here like a tubo-rat, attacking from the back, and you as=
k us for honor?" 
> 
> Cyclonus nodded, "You ask for what you yourself are =
not ready to give." Cyclonus stepped foward, his optics glowing, his hands =
dropping to his sides and a deceptivly relaxed 'ready stance', "Yet if it i=
s a battle you desire, then you shall have it."
> 
> "NO!" Rodimus' voice b=
arked out as he stepped foward, his optics bright and his weapon ready! "It=
 is me he came for, and it is *I* who will give him this battle."
> 
> Cycl=
onus glanced back at Rodimus, the slightest hint of annoyance sketching its=
elf across his face for a moment. 
> 
> "Let the boy take him" Scourge said=
 as he stepped nearer to Cyclonus, a sly smile appearing on his face, "It w=
ill lets us know what he's made of."
> 
> Cyclonus paused for a moment and =
then nodded, gesturing for Rodimus to step foward. "He is yours."
> 
> Rodi=
mus, after a slightly worried glance at Scourge and then Cyclonus, as if he=
 was only just now realizing something, stepped foward to face his new oppo=
nant. 
> 
> "I shall give you all the honor you have given us *Autobot!*" H=
e said, That last word comming out almost as a curse. With all thoughts of =
any confusion on his part lost in his readiness for battle the Dark Rodimus=
 gestured to Tuscon, "Come, come to your doom!"
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> (=
Cyclonus/Scourge/Dark Rodimus)
>
